name: Holiday Inn Paris Bastille

reviews.title: Loved Holiday Inn, Bastille
reviews.text: What a find! We stayed at the Holiday Inn 3 night is September. It was a beautiful stay. The room was beautiful and large for European standards. Hotel is very well situated for seeing Paris. The hop-on-hop off bus (a great way to see Paris) is right in front. We walked from Gare de Lyon station and the Air France bus to the airport. Also, easy walk to Notre Dame and Marais district. But the best part, was the breakfast. Excellent. If it is included in the price, it is an excellent deal. We will definately stay here again on our next trip to Paris.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel reception staff were very friendly and helpful and even though we arrived early they were still able to check us in and give us a lovely room with a balcony. The hotel was clean and comfortable in a nice area of Paris and well worth the 119 euro per night.
reviews.title: Great Hotel and location

reviews.text: The hotel is a 2 min walk from the Gare de Lyon train station were you can get trains to all over France and Italy it also has the RER line A that takes you directly to Eurodisney and metro line 1 that gets you all over Paris. The metro is also cheap and easy to use.
reviews.title: Great Staff at the Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Booked this hotel after reading the reviews on the convenient location, within walking distance from Gare de Lyon and the stop for Air France coach to Aeroport CDG.
reviews.title: Good location, good value

likes.liked: — Location, cleanliness, friendly staff, breakfast buffet

reviews.title: Poor attention to detail
reviews.text: Enjoyed my 3 nites stay. The staff at reception - Felix, Céline & Mustapha were friendly and very helpful.

Booked a family room but was given a double on arrival. But this was fixed quickly by friendly reception staff. (Watch out as the family rooms have a folding bed that looks like a wardrobe! I COMPLAINED A SECOND TIME BY MISTAKE!!)
reviews.title: Good value, handy location

likes.liked: — Size of rooms, cleanliness and location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Really easy to find if you take the bus from Charles de Gaulle. Get off at Gare de Lyon, cross the road and Rue de Lyon is just to the left. 150m along the road and you're there.
reviews.title: Nice Place!

reviews.text: Breakfast is really quite expensive - especially when, like us, you don't take it but are charged for it on departure! CHECK YOUR BILL!
reviews.title: Great Parisian hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: One of the best bakeries you'll ever find is across the road and they make croissants to die for. That takes care of breakfast! and along the Rue de Lyon is a Tea/Coffee shop you can get take aways from.
reviews.title: More than I expected

reviews.text: Overall, good value for Paris, handy for the metro and comfortable.
reviews.title: Great location, good hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Yes, unfortunately, not the best Holiday Inn.
reviews.title: Not the best Holiday Inn

reviews.text: When we checked in, we were greeted with a surly receptionist, who did not seem bothered we were there. She could not even see my name on my reservation sheet and I had to produce my passport. I did ask for a top floor room and duly got one, but wished I had’nt bothered, as these rooms are more like attic rooms with the roof sloping down along the entire length and absolutely stinking of smoke; although this entire floor is supposed to be smoke free and they have smoke alarms in the rooms??. Also it was not a kingsize bed, just a 4’ 6” double. When I asked about the safe key, the same receptionist informed me that the previous guest had not returned it! I was offered no other option. I was going to ask about changing the room, but thought it best until a more amenable receptionist was on duty. As in other reviews, yes you can see the top of the Eiffel tower from the 7th floor, but only the top and if it is hazy, then you wont see it at all! The second room we were assigned was much better with a proper sized room and kingsize bed. Of course this was my personal experience and others may not have any trouble at all, it is still annoying as I am a platinum card holder and usually receive a much better standard of service and recognition.
reviews.title: Great quality , great chic !

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall the hotel is very well used, with smoking going on in all public areas. It could do with an update, but they say on the website it has been recently upgraded? Also they may boast of sound proof rooms, but you can just hear the lift machinery if you have a room just outside the lifts. The lifts can be slow if it is busy. There are no English language programs on the in room TV, outside of pay per view – about 5 French channels and a German one! Not even CNN or BBC World!
reviews.title: Nice enough
An excellent base
reviews.text: Breakfast is good, but not much difference to a Holiday Inn express – I was expecting a full cooked option, although they do have scrambled eggs and sausages on offer along with cereals, croissants and other pastries.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Location is good – 5 mins from the Gare de Lyon – although once inside the station it can be a further 5 min walk to find the correct subway or RER LINE!
reviews.title: Excellent experience

aka: Holiday Inn Paris Bastille Hotel Paris
description: Press on this following link to discover our hotel video de l'Holiday Inn Paris Bastille. The Holiday Inn Paris Bastille hotel is ideally located in the historical heart of Paris with its famous Place de la Bastille and only a 5 minute walk from the Gare de Lyon train station with its direct access to Disneyland Resort Paris and convenient metro access to Paris Expo Porte of Versailles Exhibition Center. Only walking distances away and easy metro accesses ( metro Bastille ) from the most famous Paris leisure attractions like the Louvre Museum, Notre Dame of Paris, and George Pompidou Center. Stroll along the Seine, or go for a nice shopping spree and enjoy the exclusive Shopping District Rivoli where you can enjoy the latest Paris fashion and visit various well known Department Stores.Only a short distance away from Orly and Charles de Gaulle airports, the Stade de France, and La Defense business district, this 3 star hotel is the place to be for both leisure as well as business travellers.
